properties.description: Detailed properties for App Attach Package

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the App Attach Package.

image.description: Detailed properties for App Attach Package

keyVaultURL.description: URL path to certificate name located in keyVault

failHealthCheckOnStagingFailure.description: Parameter indicating how the health check should behave if this package fails staging

packageOwnerName.description: Specific name of package owner, is "AppAttach" for native app attach packages

packageLookbackUrl.description: Lookback url to third party control plane, is null for native app attach packages

customData.description: Field that can be populated with custom data and filtered on in list GET calls

packageAlias.description: Alias of App Attach Package. Assigned at import time

imagePath.description: VHD/CIM image path on Network Share.

packageFamilyName.description: Package Family Name from appxmanifest.xml. Contains Package Name and Publisher name.

displayName.description: User friendly Name to be displayed in the portal.

packageRelativePath.description: Relative Path to the package inside the image.

isRegularRegistration.description: Specifies how to register Package in feed.

isActive.description: Make this version of the package the active one across the hostpool.

version.description: Package version found in the appxmanifest.xml.

lastUpdated.description: Date Package was last updated, found in the appxmanifest.xml.

certificateName.description: Certificate name found in the appxmanifest.xml.

certificateExpiry.description: Date certificate expires, found in the appxmanifest.xml.

isPackageTimestamped.description: Is package timestamped so it can ignore the certificate expiry date

appId.description: Package Application Id, found in appxmanifest.xml.

appUserModelID.description: Used to activate Package Application. Consists of Package Name and ApplicationID. Found in appxmanifest.xml.

rawIcon.description: the icon a 64 bit string as a byte array.

rawPng.description: the icon a 64 bit string as a byte array.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

etag.description: If etag is provided in the response body, it may also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. showInFeed.description: Boolean representing whether the applicationGroup is show in the feed.

oboTenantId.description: Tenant that the resource is being requested on behalf of.

principalId.description: The service principal ID of the system assigned identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID of the system assigned identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

type.description: Type of managed service identity (where both SystemAssigned and UserAssigned types are allowed).

userAssignedIdentities.description: The set of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The userAssignedIdentities dictionary keys will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}. The dictionary values can be empty objects ({}) in requests.

principalId.description: The principal ID of the assigned identity.

clientId.description: The client ID of the assigned identity.

name.description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

publisher.description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

product.description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

version.description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

name.description: The name of the SKU. E.g. P3. It is typically a letter+number code

tier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

maxSessionLimit.description: The max session limit of HostPool.

loadBalancerType.description: The type of the load balancer.

vmTemplate.description: VM template for sessionhosts configuration within hostpool.

appAttachPackageReferences.description: List of App Attach Package links.

ssoadfsAuthority.description: URL to customer ADFS server for signing WVD SSO certificates.

ssoClientId.description: ClientId for the registered Relying Party used to issue WVD SSO certificates.

ssoClientSecretKeyVaultPath.description: Path to Azure KeyVault storing the secret used for communication to ADFS.

ssoSecretType.description: The type of single sign on Secret Type.

preferredAppGroupType.description: The type of preferred application group type, default to Desktop Application Group

startVMOnConnect.description: The flag to turn on/off StartVMOnConnect feature.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Enabled allows this resource to be accessed from both public and private networks, Disabled allows this resource to only be accessed via private endpoints

agentUpdate.description: The session host configuration for updating agent, monitoring agent, and stack component.

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connection associated with the specified resource

managedPrivateUDP.description: Default: AVD-wide settings are used to determine connection availability, Enabled: UDP will attempt this connection type when making connections. This means that this connection is possible, but is not guaranteed, as there are other factors that may prevent this connection type, Disabled: UDP will not attempt this connection type when making connections

directUDP.description: Default: AVD-wide settings are used to determine connection availability, Enabled: UDP will attempt this connection type when making connections. This means that this connection is possible, but is not guaranteed, as there are other factors that may prevent this connection type, Disabled: UDP will not attempt this connection type when making connections

publicUDP.description: Default: AVD-wide settings are used to determine connection availability, Enabled: UDP will attempt this connection type when making connections. This means that this connection is possible, but is not guaranteed, as there are other factors that may prevent this connection type, Disabled: UDP will not attempt this connection type when making connections

relayUDP.description: Default: AVD-wide settings are used to determine connection availability, Enabled: UDP will attempt this connection type when making connections. This means that this connection is possible, but is not guaranteed, as there are other factors that may prevent this connection type, Disabled: UDP will not attempt this connection type when making connections

managementType.description: The type of management for this hostpool, Automated or Standard. The default value is Automated.

oboTenantId.description: Tenant that the resource is being requested on behalf of.

allowRDPShortPathWithPrivateLink.description: Controls if the use of RDPShortPath transport is allowed, possibly bypassing Private Link routes.

token.description: The registration token base64 encoded string.

registrationTokenOperation.description: The type of resetting the token.

type.description: The type of maintenance for session host components.

useSessionHostLocalTime.description: Whether to use localTime of the virtual machine.

maintenanceWindowTimeZone.description: Time zone for maintenance as defined in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.timezoneinfo.findsystemtimezonebyid?view=net-5.0. Must be set if useLocalTime is true.

maintenanceWindows.description: List of maintenance windows. Maintenance windows are 2 hours long.

hour.description: The update start hour of the day. (0 - 23)

rampUpMaximumHostPoolSize.description: Maximum number of session hosts that may be created by the Scaling Service. This requires the assigned hostpool to have a session host config property.

rampUpMinimumHostPoolSize.description: Minimum number of session hosts that will be be created by the Scaling Service. Scaling will not delete any hosts when this limit is met. This requires the assigned hostpool to have a session host config property.

rampDownMaximumHostPoolSize.description: Maximum number of session hosts that may be created by the Scaling Service. This requires the assigned hostpool to have a session host config property.

rampDownMinimumHostPoolSize.description: Minimum number of session hosts that will be be created by the Scaling Service. Scaling will not delete any hosts when this limit is met. This requires the assigned hostpool to have a session host config property.

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.
Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

version.description: The timestamp of the last update.

friendlyName.description: Friendly name to describe this version of the SessionHostConfiguration.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the Session Host Configuration.

vmTags.description: Hashtable that lists key/value pair tags to apply to the VMs

vmLocation.description: The Location for the session host to be created in. It will default to the location of the hostpool if not provided

vmResourceGroup.description: The ResourceGroup for the session hosts to be created in. It will default to the ResourceGroup of the hostpool if not provided.

vmNamePrefix.description: The prefix that should be associated with session host names

availabilityZones.description: Value for availability zones to be used by the session host. Should be from [1,2,3].

vmSizeId.description: The id of the size of a virtual machine connected to a hostpool. Example: Standard_D2as_v6

customConfigurationScriptUrl.description: The uri to the storage blob containing the arm template to be run on the virtual machine after provisioning.

vmAdminCredentials.description: Local Admin credentials for session hosts."

subnetId.description: The resource ID of the subnet.

securityGroupId.description: The resource ID of the security group. Any allowable/open ports should be specified in the Network Security Group(NSG).

diffDiskSettings.description: Specifies the ephemeral disk settings for the operating system disk used by the virtual machine.

option.description: Specifies the ephemeral disk settings for operating system disk.

placement.description: Gets or sets specifies the ephemeral disk placement for operating system disk. The defaulting behavior is: CacheDisk if one is configured for the VM size otherwise ResourceDisk is used. Refer to the VM size documentation for Windows VM at https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/windows/sizes and Linux VM at https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/linux/sizes to check which VM sizes exposes a cache disk. Possible values include: 'CacheDisk', 'ResourceDisk'.

type.description: The type of image session hosts use in the hostpool.

marketplaceInfo.description: The values to uniquely identify a marketplace image. Only one should be populated based on the image type.

customInfo.description: The values to uniquely identify a custom image. Only one should be populated based on the image type.

resourceId.description: The resource ID of the image.

joinType.description: The type of domain join done by the virtual machine.

activeDirectoryInfo.description: Active directory info. Only one should be populated based on the join type.

azureActiveDirectoryInfo.description: Azure active directory info. Only one should be populated based on the join type.

domainCredentials.description: Credentials needed to create the virtual machine.

domainName.description: The domain a virtual machine connected to a hostpool will join.

usernameKeyVaultSecretUri.description: The uri to access the secret that the username is stored in.

passwordKeyVaultSecretUri.description: The uri to access the secret that the password is stored in.

type.description: The security type used by virtual machine in hostpool session host. Default is Standard.

secureBootEnabled.description: Whether to use secureBoot on the virtual machine.

vTpmEnabled.description: Whether to use vTpm on the virtual machine.

enabled.description: Whether boot diagnostics should be enabled on the Virtual Machine.

storageUri.description:
Uri of the storage account to use for placing the console output and screenshot.

If storageUri is not specified while enabling boot diagnostics, managed storage will be used.

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

scheduledDateTimeZone.description: Time zone for sessionHostManagement operations as defined in https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/system.timezoneinfo.findsystemtimezonebyid. Must be set if useLocalTime is true.

provisioning.description: Parameters that apply when session hosts are provisioned.

failedSessionHostCleanupPolicy.description: The policy that should be applied when the Session Host provisioning operation fails.

deleteOriginalVm.description: Whether not to save original disk. False by default.

maxVmsRemoved.description: The maximum number of virtual machines to be removed during hostpool update.

logOffDelayMinutes.description: Grace period before logging off users in minutes.

logOffMessage.description: Log off message sent to user for logoff. Default value is an empty string.

setDrainMode.description: Whether the session host should be set in drain mode following provisioning.

instanceCount.description: The number of session hosts to exist in the Host Pool.

canaryPolicy.description: Policy on whether a Canary VM(a single VM to validate the configuration) should be provisioned during a session host provisioning operation.

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

daysOfWeek.description: Set of days of the week on which this schedule is active.

rampUpStartTime.description: Starting time for ramp up period.

rampUpAutoStartHosts.description: The desired startup behavior during the ramp up period for personal vms in the hostpool.

rampUpStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the ramp up phase. If this is disabled, session hosts must be turned on using rampUpAutoStartHosts or by turning them on manually.

rampUpActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the ramp up period.

rampUpMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the ramp up period.

rampUpActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the ramp up period.

rampUpMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the ramp up period.

peakStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the peak phase.

peakActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the peak period.

peakMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the peak period.

peakActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the peak period.

peakMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the peak period.

rampDownStartTime.description: Starting time for ramp down period.

rampDownStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the ramp down phase.

rampDownActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the ramp down period.

rampDownMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the ramp down period.

rampDownActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the ramp down period.

rampDownMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the ramp down period.

offPeakStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the off-peak phase.

offPeakActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the off-peak period.

offPeakMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the off-peak period.

offPeakActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the off-peak period.

offPeakMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the off-peak period.
